alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 3:44PM EST until January 14 at 4:45PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray Maine has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Western Oxford County in western Maine... West central Franklin County in western Maine... Coos County in northern New Hampshire... Northeastern Grafton County in northern New Hampshire... Northern Carroll County in northern New Hampshire... * Until 445 PM EST. * At 343 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Pittsburg to near Woodstock, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 93 between mile markers 87 and 127. Locations impacted include... Conway, Berlin, Littleton, Lancaster, Fryeburg, Bethel, Bethlehem, Colebrook, Lincoln, Rangeley, Franconia, Andover, Errol, Pittsburg, Grafton, Dixville, Woodstock, Stratford, Pinkham Notch, and Mount Washington. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
